locutie.beschrijving: The sermon describes the persecution of the early church in Jerusalem and its subsequent scattering as a catalyst for the spread of the Gospel. It connects this historical narrative to contemporary struggles (civil rights, personal loss) and the overarching theme of God's plan.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Moderate. The preacher uses the text as a springboard for a topical exploration of 'trouble' rather than a verse-by-verse exposition.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher primarily asserts the reality of God's plan and encourages the congregation to endure. There is a strong movement from asserting historical facts to promising future clarity.
voorbeelden: God has a plan for your life.
I tell you what I believe.
We'll understand it better by and by.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To comfort the distressed, instill resilience, and move the hearer from panic to trust.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Implicit. The Spirit is mentioned as a historical actor in Jerusalem, but less as the current agent of the sermon's efficacy.

voorbeelden: Trouble belongs to all of us!
The inspired disciples were in Jerusalem.
Never forget that God can make a way.
We must learn to read and write.
I cannot tell you how large he was in my eyes.
God will take care of us.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Weak. Most promises are framed as general truths (Assertives) rather than direct 'I promise you' (Commissives).

voorbeelden: I testify now that the Lord has worked it out.
declaratieven.autoriteit: Low. The preacher speaks more as a witness than as a mandatory of a reality-changing word.

indicatoren: General sociological observations about affirmative action
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer receives information about God's plan but may not feel the immediate 'event' of God acting upon them.

performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Faith is directed toward a future 'by and by' rather than a present encounter.

voorbeelden: God has a plan for your life.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address to the congregation, often conditional ('If you...').
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used mostly in directives and conditional promises.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing the early church, God, and social issues.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a lecture-like distance in the middle section.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General theological truths about God's nature.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (God has a plan) -> Directive (You must qualify).
voorbeelden: He has a plan... but the plan cannot be operative until you accept your part.
foutief_patroon.probleem: Makes the promise contingent on human action (synergism), weakening the performative force.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because God has a plan, do not panic.
voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: You're eligible, but you've got to qualify.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon leans heavily on the hearer's need to 'qualify' for the promise, turning the performative word into a conditional offer.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: I cannot tell you how large he was in my eyes.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The plan cannot be operative until you accept your part.
zwakke_punten.probleem: Obscures the unconditional nature of the Gospel promise.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is more of a motivational speech about God's plan than a sacramental event where God acts.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The 'Toezegging' is weakened by the 'Qualifying' requirement.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: God is spoken ABOUT more than God is heard SPEAKING.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts as a witness/testifier.
tekstueel_bewijs: I tell you what I believe.

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Not explicitly left to the Spirit; relies on the hearer's 'qualifying'.
tekstueel_bewijs: The mighty inrushing wind... came upon them.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Low. The sermon is a 'message' rather than a 'means'.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Limited to the 'By and By' section.
tekstueel_bewijs: One day we'll understand it better.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many 'musts' and 'is/was' verbs; too few 'I grant/I promise' verbs.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: God has a plan for your life.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: In the name of Jesus, I announce to you: God is claiming your life for His plan right now.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a fact to an act.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is locked behind a door of 'qualifying'.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Proclaim the promise as the power that enables the qualifying.
voorbeeldzinnen: Because Christ has qualified for you, this kingdom is yours.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much 'they' (the early church) and 'it' (the plan).
voorbeeldzinnen: You are the ones being scattered; you are the ones God is using.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The imperative (you must) precedes the full comfort of the indicative.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Let the declarative 'You are forgiven/held' be the basis for 'Therefore, stand'.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has powerful rhetorical rhythm and emotional resonance, but it needs to shift from 'talking about' God's plan to 'enacting' God's grace.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's self-revelation (his father's death); SAT focuses on whether that story serves a divine illocution.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetoric admires the 'By and By' climax; SAT asks if that climax actually delivers the peace it describes.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the 'qualifying' language creates a 'felicity failure' in the promise.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: God has a plan for your life.
We'll understand it better by and by.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'Black Homiletic' styleâ€”rhythmically brilliant but, in this specific text, structurally stuck in the indicative/assertive mode until the very end.
